thread.title: Seventh grade football team falls in Ottumwa
thread.title_full: Seventh grade football team falls in Ottumwa

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Seventh grade football team falls in Ottumwa
text:
Seventh grade football team falls in Ottumwa Oct 12, 2015 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
OTTUMWA — The seventh grade football team had two hard-fought games at Ottumwa last Tuesday night, but the Bulldogs escaped with a sweep, defeating the Panther Maroon Team, 16-14, and the Gold Team, 12-0. 
For the Maroon team, Cooper Pullis had a touchdown run in the second quarter, and Mitch Moothart caught a two-point conversion pass to make it 8-8. Then, in the third quarter, Brennen Bender broke free for a 25-yard touchdown run to make it 14-6. Ottumwa scored eight points in the fourth, though, and walked away with a two-point victory. 
Bender led the team with 52 yards on the ground. Brevin Wilson had 11 yards rushing, Chase Williamson had six, Cooper Pullis had five and Avery Scandridge had two. 
Brevin Wilson went 4-10 and had 35 yards through the air. Bender caught two of those passes, for 27 yards, and Williamson and Moothart had one apiece. 
Defensively, the Maroon team recovered three fumbles; one by Bender, one by Izaac Lance and one by Riley Sammons. 
In the Gold team’s 12-point loss, Olivia Larson led the team on offense with 65 yards on just two rushes. Tyson Sysouchanh had 18 yards rushing, Aeryn Wilson had eight, Clayton Wilson had six, Darius Walker had five and Joe Holtkamp had two. 
C. Wilson was 1-2 for 12 yards to lead all passers. Walker and A. Wilson had five passing attempts between them, but no completions. Brian Huynh had the lone catch on the day, for 12 yards. Sysouchanh had the only takeaway for the Gold team. He had one fumble recovery.
